place.name: BOULSTON
place.gazetteerText: BOULSTON, or Bulston, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; on the river. Cleddau, 4 miles SE by S of Haverfordwest r. station. Post Town, Haverfordwest. Acres, 1,822; of which 160 are water. Real property, £948. Pop., 254. Houses, 54. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to R. J. Ackland, Esq. The living is a donative in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £25. Patron, R. J. Ackland, Esq The church contains monuments of the Wogans; and is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
